title: Compton - wavelength at 80 deg for incident 6 pm

content.question: Photons with an initial wavelength of <math alttext="6.0 picometers" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>6.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>pm</mtext></math> are incident on a sample of material. Within the material, the photons are scattered from electrons that can be treated as being at rest. What is the wavelength of scattered photons that are observed at an angle of <math alttext="eighty degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mn>80</mn><mo>âˆ˜</mo></msup></math> from the direction of the incident photons?
